hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{21}$ action figures.


And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

There are $\purpleC3$ action figures per box.

The quotient will tell us the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$ is the $\blueD{\text{number of boxes}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\blueD{\text{number of boxes}}$.

question.content:
Kaleb has $21$ action figures. He puts $3$ action figures in each box.

**What does the expression $21\div3$ represent?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 2]]

choices.content: Number of action figures in each box
